column4: tried it numerous times with no luck, it just kept crashing or telling me version 5.5 is not support which is like exchange 1998
I really thought there would be proper support for exchange 2010 on linux... Do I really have to run vm to get this crap working?
exchange is MS prioritary "email" and your surprised it doesn't work....
[ i can't help you ] but are you using 12.10?  if so, resolv.conf is deprecated... you're having "internet/DNS" issues right?  are you using N-M?  if so, resolv.conf wouldn't help anyways (i believe)

sorry (i don't see either TJ- or Meris's comments to you - so i don't know what you're hearing) but resolv.conf is deprecated in 12.04 and most of it's setting have been moved to /etc/network/interfaces (i believe!).  certainly don't follow ANY of my advice without confirmation from someone in the channel.
LIAR - i don't think so.  resolv.conf is deprecated.
for one thing, using /etc/network/interfaces disables network-manager (the default networking on ubuntu)...
and where does resol.conf come into play? used by /etc/network/interfaces or network-manager or both?
i'm not up to speed on the current stuff!  but my impression is that N-M NO LONGER uses resolv.conf in 12.04+
